specimen_type: Left breast, upper outer quadrant, core needle biopsy
clinical_history: 52-year-old female with a palpable mass in the left breast. Mammography shows a 2.1cm irregular spiculated mass (BI-RADS 5). Ultrasound-guided core biopsy performed.
gross_description: Received in formalin labeled 'left breast core biopsy' are four tan-white tissue cores, each measuring 1.2 to 1.5 cm in length and 0.1 cm in diameter. The tissue is firm and tan-white on cut surface. Entirely submitted in one cassette.

microscopic_findings.finding: Invasive ductal carcinoma, not otherwise specified (NOS)
microscopic_findings.details: Moderately differentiated infiltrating carcinoma arranged in irregular nests, cords, and tubules. Tumor cells show moderate nuclear pleomorphism with visible nucleoli and occasional mitotic figures.
microscopic_findings.grade_component: Tubule formation: 2, Nuclear pleomorphism: 2, Mitotic count: 2

microscopic_findings.details: Associated intermediate-grade DCIS with cribriform and solid patterns. No comedo necrosis identified.
Focal lymphovascular invasion identified in one core.
Moderate desmoplastic stromal reaction surrounding invasive tumor nests. Scattered tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes present.

diagnosis: Left breast, core needle biopsy: Invasive ductal carcinoma, Nottingham grade 2 (moderately differentiated), with associated intermediate-grade DCIS and focal lymphovascular invasion.

staging.notes: Final pathologic staging pending excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy.

margins.notes: Margin assessment deferred to excision specimen.
